searchDocs.title: CameraCFrame​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac.CameraCFrame: CFrame  The last known Camera CFrame of the Player.

searchDocs.title: Character​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac.Character: Model  A Model controlled by the Player that contains a Humanoid, body parts, scripts and other objects.

searchDocs.title: Connections​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac.Connections: table Table that stores the connections used by Rjac.

searchDocs.title: Enabled​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac.Enabled: bool Determines whether body parts will be rotated.

searchDocs.title: JointConfigurations​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac.JointConfigurations: table Joint configurations for rotating, joint offsets, multipliers, rotation axes.

searchDocs.title: Player​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac.Player: Player  Player/owner of the Rjac object.

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac.new( RjacInfo: table-- Table of stuff to overwrite default Rjac stuff with ) → () Creates a new Rjac Object.

searchDocs.title: AddBodyJoint​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac:AddBodyJoint( BodyPart: string,-- Name of the body part. BodyJoint: string,-- Name of the body joint. MultiplierVector: Vector3 ,-- Vector by which the rotation angle will be multiplied. LookVectorAxes: table-- CameraCFrame.LookVector axes which will be used to rotate the joint axes ) → () Add body joint to the list of joints which are to be rotated.

searchDocs.title: Destroy​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac:Destroy() → () Disconnects all connections, sets the joint offsets back to defauly, deletes everything.

searchDocs.title: error​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac:error( arg1: any, arg2: any, arg3: any, arg4: any ) → () A wrapper function for the default error, adds some stuff at the start

searchDocs.title: Initiate​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac:Initiate() → () Creates and stores the connection to listen for Player.CharacterAdded event

searchDocs.title: OnCharacterAdded​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac:OnCharacterAdded( Character: model-- The Player Character ) → () Function to be run when the Player gets a new Character. Waits for the avatar to be fully loaded, then calls :ResetJointOffsets(Character).

searchDocs.title: print​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac:print( arg1: any, arg2: any, arg3: any, arg4: any ) → () A wrapper function for the default print, adds some stuff at the start

searchDocs.title: RemoveBodyJoint​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac:RemoveBodyJoint( BodyPart: string,-- Name of the body part. BodyJoint: string-- Name of the body joint. ) → () Remove a specific body joint from the Rjac.JointConfigurations

searchDocs.title: ResetJointOffsets​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac:ResetJointOffsets( Character: Model -- The target Character to read from ) → () Reads and stores the Motor6D.C0 into JointConfigurations[].JointOffset. Not meant to be used every single time.

searchDocs.title: Update​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac:Update( CameraCFrame: CFrame -- The Player's Camera.CFrame ) → () Updates the CameraCFrame and then rotates the body joints accordingly

searchDocs.title: UpdateBodyJointMultiplierVector​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac:UpdateBodyJointMultiplierVector( BodyPart: string,-- Name of the body part. BodyJoint: string,-- Name of the body joint. MultiplierVector: Vector3 -- Vector by which the rotation angle will be multiplied. ) → () Update body joint multiplier vector for a specific joint.

searchDocs.title: UpdateBodyJointOffset​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac:UpdateBodyJointOffset( BodyPart: string,-- Name of the body part. BodyJoint: string,-- Name of the body joint. JointOffset: CFrame -- CFrame by which the rotations are offset. ) → () Update body joint offset for a specific joint.

searchDocs.title: warn​
searchDocs.content: </> Rjac:warn( arg1: any, arg2: any, arg3: any, arg4: any ) → () A wrapper function for the default warn, adds some stuff at the start
